abstract: Hezbollah, in retaliation for Israeli drone strike in Syria that killed six of its fighters, launches two antitank missiles along disputed Lebanese-Israeli border that kill two Israeli soldiers; latest cross-border attack is most deadly in the area since 2006, raising concerns of escalating conflict.
lead_paragraph: The missile strike was the latest in a string of events along Israel’s northern frontiers that have raised the risk of a broader confrontation.

byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren reported from Jerusalem, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Reporting was contributed by Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem, Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Raphael Minder from Madrid and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.
byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and ANNE BARNARD

snippet: The missile strike was the latest in a string of events along Israel’s northern frontiers that have raised the risk of a broader confrontation.

headline.main: Hezbollah Kills 2 Israeli Soldiers Near Lebanon
headline.print_headline: Hezbollah Kills Israeli Soldiers Near Lebanon
